thread.title: Cristiano Ronaldo escapes punishment after throwing ball at Vitolo during Real Madrid's defeat to Sevilla
thread.title_full: Cristiano Ronaldo escapes punishment after throwing ball at Vitolo during Real Madrid's defeat to Sevilla

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Cristiano Ronaldo escapes punishment after throwing ball at Vitolo during Real Madrid's defeat to Sevilla
text:
Sport Cristiano Ronaldo escapes punishment after throwing ball at Vitolo during Real Madrid's defeat to Sevilla Ronaldo clashed with the midfielder before he took a penalty but Sevilla hit back late on to end Real's 40-game unbeaten run in dramatic style Share Cristiano Ronaldo and Vitolo clash (Photo: AFP) Share Get Real Madrid CF   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Cristiano Ronaldo was fortunate to avoid punishment after throwing the ball at an opponent during Real Madrid's defeat to Sevilla. 
Zinedine Zidane's men saw their 40-game unbeaten run come to an end at Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan as Stevan Jovetic scored a last-gasp stunner. 
Ronaldo opened the scoring for the visitors with a penalty - but only after a melee between the two sets of players. 
The Portuguese reacted angrily after Vitolo appeared to be scuffing the penalty spot and threw the ball against the back of the midfielder. 
The incident sparked a scuffle between the two sides although both players escaped without a card. Cristiano Ronaldo gestures (Photo: AFP) Ronaldo celebrates after scoring (Photo: REUTERS) 
Ronaldo dusted himself down to fire home from the spot but Real were pegged back. 
Sergio Ramos headed into his own net to draw the hosts level late on but the drama was far from over. 
Having scored against Real in the Copa del Rey in midweek, Jovetic struck again as he beat Keylor Navas with a fine strike. Sergio Ramos scores an own goal (Photo: AFP) Sevilla's Stevan Jovetic celebrates (Photo: AFP) 
After the clash, boss Zinedine Zidane admitted his side let their foot of the gas. 
"We relaxed for five minutes and that was enough to let the win escape for us," he said. 
"It's hard to take considering how the game went, but that's football and we have to accept the result. We'll use this as motivation for our next game." 
The win sees Sevilla climb back into second and just a point adrift of Madrid, while Barcelona are two off the pace. poll loading Will Real Madrid win La Liga this season? 2000+ VOTES SO FAR
